intro: Senecio santelicis, commonly known as the mountain senecio, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in arid or semi-arid environments. It produces small yellow flowers that bloom in summer, and its leaves are usually gray-green with a fuzzy texture. Senecio santelicis is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its attractive appearance and hardy nature.
